title: Reflection - two mirrors joined at 110 degrees

content.question: Two flat mirrors, Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are joined together and meet at an angle of <math alttext="110 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>110</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math>, as shown in the figure. A laser beam is incident on Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> at an angle of <math alttext="50 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>50</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> from the normal. The beam is reflected from Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and is then incident on Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, where it is reflected a second time. What is the angle between the final reflected beam and the normal to Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?
